page.title: 09Ecology in Parbold
page.content: {Wildlife:}The people we interviewed} spoke highly of the area they lived in. The land was good for walking and rambling, and a group of the boys had undertaken a survey of the wildlife and birdlife that they saw whilst they were in the area. Squirrels, foxes, deer, a kestrel and a whole host of different types of birds were seen. {Pollution:}The Leeds-Liverpool Canal{ runs through the village, and near the canal they saw a mallard duck and ducklings but significantly they did see some dead fish, and it is wondered in the village itself whether the canal is being polluted from the quarry at the top of the Hill.
